definitions.text: a rational motive for a belief or action
examples: the reason that war was declared

definitions.text: an explanation of the cause of some phenomenon
examples: the reason a steady state was never reached was that the back pressure built up too slowly

definitions.text: the capacity for rational thought or inference or discrimination
examples: we are told that man is endowed with reason and capable of distinguishing good from evil

definitions.text: the state of having good sense and sound judgment
examples: his rationality may have been impaired
he had to rely less on reason than on rousing their emotions

definitions.text: a justification for something existing or happening
examples: he had no cause to complain
they had good reason to rejoice

definitions.text: a fact that logically justifies some premise or conclusion
examples: there is reason to believe he is lying

definitions.text: decide by reasoning; draw or come to a conclusion
examples: We reasoned that it was cheaper to rent than to buy a house
The children must learn to reason
